intro: Strobilanthes scabrida, commonly known as the rough strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
